sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A recommendation to Mercurius Morbicus. Together with a fair character upon his worth. To the reader. Unto the arrant'st knave that lives by bread, I send this greeting; (you may please to read) ... I may to many now seem to deface him, but when I physick take, O then, I'le grace him. Taylor, John, 1580-1653.
8 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the yeer 1647.
Partly in verse. Anonymous. Attributed to John Taylor. Mercurius Morbicus = Henry Walker, ironmonger. Place of publication from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy: "8ber [i.e. October] 6th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

8 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the yeer 1647.
Partly in verse. Anonymous. Attributed to John Taylor. Mercurius Morbicus = Henry Walker, ironmonger. Place of publication from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy: "8ber [i.e. October] 6th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
